alert.note: Alert for Macomb; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Macomb and St. Clair Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Romeo, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Armada around 425 PM EDT. Richmond around 440 PM EDT. New Baltimore and Memphis around 445 PM EDT. Marine City around 515 PM EDT. St. Clair around 520 PM EDT. Marysville around 525 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Anchorville, North Street, Adair, Shelby Township, Rattle Run, Goodells, Ray Center, Utica, Smiths Creek and Washington. Additional thunderstorms in the vicinity may also produce gusty winds and very heavy downpours. People attending Brandenburg Park , and St Clair Palmer Park should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
